description: We are a theatre company for performers and artists with learning disabilities in the West London area.  We will screen a free immersive experience, run on a loop, entitled Red Rope. It tells a powerful story about the impact of plastic on our oceans and features artworks, dance, music and poetry by our performers and artists. We will also display works of art.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: This building used to be the Library Resource Centre for the Borough of Ealing, but was refurbished by 2014 with funding from Ealing Council, the Social Investment Business, Arts Council England and others to create the IMPACT Community Arts Centre. It is a multi-use facility featuring areas for art, music, drama, dance/yoga and IT plus a cafe and a garden area. The building houses a day service (IMPACT Outreach Network) and a theatre company (IMPACT Theatre) for performers and artists with learning disabilities. IMPACT has been running for more than two decades. IMPACT Theatre was a recipient of the Queen's Award for Voluntary Service 2018.

images.title: Red Rope immersive experience in our Studio Theatre

location.address: Ealing Central Sports Ground, Horsenden Lane South, Greenford

name: IMPACT Community Arts Centre
